titleStmt.title: To A. E. J. Modderman 3 June 1875

availability.licence: DCP-LETT-10007G by The Darwin Correspondence Project is licensed under a Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0). Based on a work at https://www.darwinproject.ac.uk/letter/?docId=letters/DCP-LETT-10007G.xml.

sourceDesc.bibl: Leiden University Libraries (shelfmark ASF inv.nr. 327 document 86)

abstract.p: Thanks for the diploma conferring on him an honorary doctorate of medicine from Leiden University.

placeName.hi: Down, | Beckenham, Kent. | Railway Station | Orpington. S.E.R.

div.p: I beg leave to acknowledge the receipt of your obliging letter of Mar 26, and of the Diploma from the University of Leyden. I request that you will be so good, on any fitting occasion, to present to the Senate of your University my sincere acknowledgements for this distinguished honour, which is most highly gratifying to me—
I beg leave to remain | Sir | your obliged & obedient | Servant | Charles Darwin

div.note: See this volume, Supplement, letter from A. E. J. Modderman to C. R. Darwin and 20 others, 24 March 1875. The diploma is in DAR 229: 40. It was published with a translation of the Latin in Correspondence vol. 23, Appendix III. It conferred the honorary degree of doctor of medicine.
